TopicTitle: [Cinematic] The Kerbal Space Race - Chapter 1: The beginning of everything

Articles.Content:
Hello again!

After Youtube went NUTS at me because I used an Apollo 11 landing footage on one video, I

decided to make a jump, and start a new channel dedicated to animations, cinematics... etc.

(That includes Kerbal Space Program)

So I started a new cinematic series about how Kerbals "mastered" rocket science imitating real-life

missions like Apollo, Mercury, Soyuz and more missions like Duna Explorer and so on.

The first chapter is the "Mercury-Redstone" mission when Kerbals went to space for the first time.

(I hope Youtube doesn't **** me another time with copyrighted stuff)

(Btw, that video may contain TYPOS and errors, but I'm spanish and my english level is not perfect. I hope that's not a problem)

Great work, looking forward to the next episode

I know this could be considered as plugging, but since you look like a pretty senior cinematic producer, what do you think of mine?

and something else I did including a quote by Carl Sagan:

Edited December 24, 2013 by HatBat

Great work, looking forward to the next episode

I know this could be considered as plugging, but since you look like a pretty senior cinematic producer, what do you think of mine?

and something else I did including a quote by Carl Sagan:

"...you look like a pretty senior cinematic producer..." Oh nonononono >.<

I'm not that good, there is a lot of people with more talent than me. I just do this like a Hobby :3

BTW, both of your videos are awesome, the only thing that I recommend you is to put less "static" videos. Move the camera a bit or better, If you use vegas, make the video smaller and make two keyframes at the start and at the end and move the video a bit. With that, the scene looks more interesting :3

"...you look like a pretty senior cinematic producer..." Oh nonononono >.<

I'm not that good, there is a lot of people with more talent than me. I just do this like a Hobby :3

BTW, both of your videos are awesome, the only thing that I recommend you is to put less "static" videos. Move the camera a bit or better, If you use vegas, make the video smaller and make two keyframes at the start and at the end and move the video a bit. With that, the scene looks more interesting :3

http://i.imgur.com/bfnoROM.jpg

Nice to get some advice, I actually use adobe suite but the same technique apply's. Anyway, that's also a relief because, as you probably know, kerbcam uses chase mode so getting a moving shot while the craft is spinning is almost impossible. So thanks for the tip
Really love it, I subscribed, can't wait for the next episode. Could you share some tips when it comes to Vegas?
